text: I spent Sunday morning gardening and later cooked dinner with my family. We laughed and planned a short hiking trip for next week.
label: Normal

text: Work has been fulfilling lately and I feel balanced. In the evenings I read novels before getting a solid night of sleep.
label: Normal

text: I met neighbors for a block party, played board games, and enjoyed staying connected with the community.
label: Normal

text: My routine includes exercise, meal prepping, and journaling. I feel calm and optimistic about upcoming projects.
label: Normal

text: I unwind by painting landscapes and listening to mellow playlists. It keeps me relaxed and centered.
label: Normal

text: I feel steady during meetings at work and make time for tea breaks to keep a healthy rhythm.
label: Normal

text: Morning yoga, chatting with friends, and cooking new recipes help me stay grounded and content.
label: Normal

text: I enjoy commuting on my bike, greeting familiar faces, and ending the day with a favorite podcast.
label: Normal

text: Weekly volunteering at the animal shelter gives me purpose and keeps my mood positive.
label: Normal

text: I hosted a game night, cleaned the apartment, and caught up on my reading list. Everything feels balanced.
label: Normal

text: My heart keeps racing and I worry that something terrible is about to happen even though nothing is wrong.
label: Anxiety

text: Before bed my mind spins with worst-case scenarios, making it hard to breathe steadily or relax.
label: Anxiety

text: I obsessively check if the stove is off because I fear I might hurt someone without noticing.
label: Anxiety

text: Public transit makes me jittery; I keep replaying embarrassing memories and fear judgment everywhere.
label: Anxiety

text: Whenever the phone rings I panic, convinced the call brings bad news or tragedy.
label: Anxiety

text: I clasp my hands so tightly during meetings because I worry about saying something foolish.
label: Anxiety

text: Even on weekends I cannot calm down; my stomach knots as I await problems that never show up.
label: Anxiety

text: My thoughts spiral into what-if catastrophes whenever my partner is late returning home.
label: Anxiety

text: Small decisions like choosing dinner feel paralyzing because I fear every choice might be disastrous.
label: Anxiety

text: I constantly monitor my breathing, convinced I'm seconds away from losing control.
label: Anxiety

text: My supervisor dumped six urgent tasks on me and I can feel the pressure pounding behind my eyes.
label: Stress

text: Deadlines overlap with family commitments; I’m stretched so thin that I can’t sleep without worrying about unfinished work.
label: Stress

text: I juggle two jobs and caregiving duties, barely finding time to eat. My shoulders tense from the strain.
label: Stress

text: Every ping from my inbox makes me flinch because I expect another request I cannot manage.
label: Stress

text: I grind my teeth while previewing tomorrow’s agenda; it feels like a weight pressing down on my chest.
label: Stress

text: I zone out during conversations because I’m mentally reciting lists of obligations I still owe people.
label: Stress

text: Traffic delays, angry clients, and financial strain have me clenching my jaw all day long.
label: Stress

text: Balancing school, part-time work, and childcare leaves me exhausted before noon.
label: Stress

text: My smartwatch keeps warning about high stress levels while I rush between meetings.
label: Stress

text: My calendar is so packed that even five quiet minutes feel impossible.
label: Stress

text: Lately I wake up wishing I could stay asleep because facing each day feels pointless and heavy.
label: Depression

text: I skip showers and ignore messages because I can barely gather the energy to move.
label: Depression

text: Food tastes bland and I no longer find joy in music, art, or time with friends.
label: Depression

text: I cry silently in the bathroom at work and pretend everything is fine when I return to my desk.
label: Depression

text: It feels like I’m wading through mud; even washing dishes is overwhelming.
label: Depression

text: My thoughts insist that nothing will improve, so I hide under blankets for hours.
label: Depression

text: I stare at the ceiling most nights wondering whether anyone would notice if I disappeared.
label: Depression

text: I stopped attending hobbies I once loved because the motivation has completely vanished.
label: Depression

text: My friends invite me out but I decline, fearing I’ll drag everyone down with my sadness.
label: Depression

text: I move slowly, talk softly, and feel numb even during happy moments.
label: Depression

text: I’ve begun writing goodbye letters and considering ways to end my life peacefully.
label: Suicidal

text: The idea of continuing feels unbearable, and I’ve researched lethal doses late at night.
label: Suicidal

text: I often stand near bridges imagining how quick the drop would be if I jumped.
label: Suicidal

text: I hide sharp objects because I fear I might use them when despair peaks.
label: Suicidal

text: I told a close friend that I don’t see the point of existing, and I meant it.
label: Suicidal

text: I visualize overdosing on medication almost every evening when the emptiness returns.
label: Suicidal

text: I gave away cherished belongings as if preparing to leave permanently.
label: Suicidal

text: I reread old texts so I can remember what to say in a final message to loved ones.
label: Suicidal

text: I search online for painless ways to die, convinced that relief only comes through ending everything.
label: Suicidal

text: I walk around feeling detached, planning farewells nobody else can hear.
label: Suicidal

text: My mood skyrockets for days—I barely sleep, start huge projects, and spend money wildly—then I crash into despair.
label: Bipolar

text: During highs I talk rapidly and feel invincible; during lows I can’t leave bed for days.
label: Bipolar

text: I alternate between planning grand ventures and feeling worthless with no warning.
label: Bipolar

text: Friends say I seem like two different people depending on the week.
label: Bipolar

text: I once booked spontaneous flights and quit my job without notice, then later begged for it back.
label: Bipolar

text: I feel electric energy buzzing through me, so I pace for hours before collapsing into exhaustion.
label: Bipolar

text: I rearrange my apartment overnight during manic bursts, then regret everything days later.
label: Bipolar

text: I oscillate between lavish gifts for strangers and isolating from everyone.
label: Bipolar

text: Medication helps some, but I still experience extreme highs where I believe I can control the weather.
label: Bipolar

text: My family hides my credit cards during manic streaks to protect our finances.
label: Bipolar

text: I worry that everyone secretly hates me, so I cling to people and then push them away violently.
label: Personality Disorder

text: My sense of self changes daily; some mornings I feel superior, others I feel empty.
label: Personality Disorder

text: Arguments escalate quickly because I interpret neutral comments as personal attacks.
label: Personality Disorder

text: I switch between idolizing partners and despising them whenever I fear abandonment.
label: Personality Disorder

text: Impulsive spending, reckless driving, and sudden tantrums leave me ashamed afterward.
label: Personality Disorder

text: I sometimes dissociate, watching myself from far away when emotions intensify.
label: Personality Disorder

text: People say I manipulate, but I’m terrified of being alone so I do whatever it takes to keep someone close.
label: Personality Disorder

text: My friendships burn bright and collapse quickly because my reactions are extreme.
label: Personality Disorder

text: I feel chronically empty, so I start conflicts just to feel something.
label: Personality Disorder

text: Minor criticism sends me into spirals of rage or despair within minutes.
label: Personality Disorder

text: I hear coded warnings inside the static of radios and the flicker of street lamps.
label: Psychotic-like

text: The neighbors are actors planted by a secret agency; their blinks send signals to drones.
label: Psychotic-like

text: When I watch television, the anchors pause to respond to my private thoughts.
label: Psychotic-like

text: I’m certain hidden microphones in the ceiling record my every whisper.
label: Psychotic-like

text: The clouds rearrange themselves to guide my decisions; ignoring them brings disaster.
label: Psychotic-like

text: Strangers in the mall read my mind and repeat my thoughts out loud to test me.
label: Psychotic-like

text: I see patterns in license plates that spell instructions only I can decode.
label: Psychotic-like

text: Food tastes different because the cafeteria injects chemicals to control my behavior.
label: Psychotic-like

text: I cover mirrors because my reflection belongs to an alternate version tracking me.
label: Psychotic-like

text: The government installed chips in my teeth; I can hear them buzzing when I resist orders.
label: Psychotic-like
